website_summaries.verdict: The best litter box to prevent litter from tracking all over your home.
pros: Top-entry design effectively eliminates messes surrounding the litter box
The box has a sleek, modern design that fits with most decor
Grooved lid doubles as a mat for cats to wipe their paws on
High, seamless walls are perfect for cats with bad aim
cons: Deep box is difficult to scoop clean
Older cats may have trouble getting in and out

customer_reviews.title: Cats enjoy the privacy
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this thinking it would be dog-proof. It is not. Cats enjoy the privacy. So far it seems easier to manage and clean than a regular box. Just don’t think your dumb dog won’t be able to get in somehow... he’s 85 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Luckwitz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent litter box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. I love how visitors dont know they are litter boxes at first glance. I have three cats and my largest is a male bengal that weighs close to 20 lbs. He is massive. He hopped right in and did his business. The top held him well and it wasn't too small inside for his personal liking. Going to order two more when the white comes back in stock.
customer_reviews.author: boomerang

customer_reviews.title: horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: It was a great litter box and my cats actually liked it ... However, I'm EXTREMELY disappointed in the quality of this product... I've only had this for a couple months and the base of the box has cracked along the curve of the bottom... I went to change the base litter (as I do every few weeks) and found the crack. I don't over fill the litter and my cats are not overweight either...
customer_reviews.author: Colette

customer_reviews.title: Litterbox top lid collapses into the litterbox!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this litterbox to replace my Modkat that had broken at the hinges. It’s much cheaper than the Modkat and seemed to serve the same function. Wrong! After the first night, I found this Iris litterbox with the top collapsed into the litter. The mechanism holding the litterbox top in place is poorly designed and of cheap quality. It could easily pop off when a cat is standing on the lid, then fall into the litterbox. Traumatic for the cat that falls in, and extra work for me. Plus, it renders the box non-functional! I want a refund!
customer_reviews.author: BeInspired

customer_reviews.title: My cats had no issues with getting in and out ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats had no issues with getting in and out of this. However, the cat litter was still being tracked outside of it and on the top. The scopper that comes with this is only the size of a large spoon, not a normal size scooper. The top is difficult to remove, you have to unhook it and then lift up a certain way. I sent this back for a refund, and won't be buying this ever again
customer_reviews.author: kitty198125

customer_reviews.title: I'm keeping it but definitely don't live it recommend it
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for over a month now.. It's better to look at than a regular box.. liter is all over the floor so that aspect was a bust. My furbabie uses it fine with no adjustment really.. but the larger version if this is still too small for him.. height wise.. he can't really utilize the back space. So all of his waste is right under the opening which makes it hard for him to cover so he scratches the sides to satisfy his self. So yes it's nice to look at, not $30+ worth of pretty thou.. but not very functional, for my baby anyway.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe for any cat over 11lbs
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty, sleek and nice color 1 star We have 2 cats,both weighing between 11-13lbs. The lid collapsed into the box when one cat was exiting. The only connection points for lid are two push to release buttons on the side and small tab into wide slot on one end. So if the cat is on the lid and side flex out the lid falls down! And you don’t want traumatizing Litterbox!
customer_reviews.author: S. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This litter box was well worth the month-long wait. We were worried our cat wouldn’t know how to use it but he took to it right away. It’s very thick and durable plastic and the top entry has made scooping easier. It hasn’t completely eliminated litter tracking but it has reduced it by about 90% and I would even say it has reduced the smell. The design is great too—most people we have over don’t realize it’s a litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A little worried my cat might not love. Put it where old litter box was
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday. A little worried my cat might not love. Put it where old litter box was. He had no problem. Love this design. Rounded fits much better in my condo. Less litter everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Watson

customer_reviews.title: Resulted in poop and pee all over the house
customer_reviews.text: Liked the look and idea of this litter box vs. our very traditional one. Decided to take a $30 flyer on it. Cat actively disliked this monstrosity. We knew we would have problems after she actively recoiled in horror when we introduced it alongside her usual litter box. Well, even having both as options pissed her off royally enough to go poop and pee on a homemade quilt and the sofa. This litter box disrupted what was a perfectly trained litter box cat.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B.

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love it and I do too
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful design for a litter box. What took so long. This keeps litter in the container, keeps dogs out and is easy to clean. I was concerned at first because my kittens are only 8 weeks but I gave them a ledge and cover so now they know how to use it - they also sleep and play on it too! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mosky

customer_reviews.title: They should have thought of the this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: They should have thought of this years ago! Best box. I liked the oval design better than the square because my big 20lb tabby fits . The design is great for keeping the dogs out of it. Open top does mean a little more odor but I clean twice a day anyway because I have more than one cat
customer_reviews.author: The Little Engine that could

customer_reviews.title: Does not reduce litter mess
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend if you are looking for something to minimize the litter tracking. The only nice things about this litter box is how it looks sleek and minimalist. But there are a few major things I dislike about this litter box. 1. It's deep, which makes it harder to clean. 2. Its curved, which also makes it hard to clean since your scoop is straight. 3. Does not keep litter from tracking 4. Does not have handles so it's hard to carry
customer_reviews.author: I. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Form Far Exceeds Function
customer_reviews.text: I just got the litter box today. It looks great and would be wonderful except the lid doesn't fit well at all. The lid just collapses into the box when my cats try to go in and out. I prefer top entry boxes, and this one looks so much better than the type I've had in the past, but it is not functioning properly because the lid does not secure properly to the box.
customer_reviews.author: k in the qc

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice looking litter box
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking litter box, I loved it but my cat did not. I guess it is because she is older and used to conventional litter boxes. It terrified her to be in it and she would just jump out, like she didn't understand the purpose of it. I supposed it is better for a more daring kitty who is more active and open minded . But I really loved the design, the material is good, the colors are neutral and stylish and the style is very modern. But I guess is not for every cat, I wish my cat had liked it. I gave it four stars because is not for every cat.
customer_reviews.author: Espi

customer_reviews.title: Cat will not use!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a whole month now and my cat has only used it once and that when it was on it's side as another user recommended. My cat is an 8 yr old male weighing about 14 lbs. I even put a small stool next to it because he is not a big jumper. Nothing. Various little tricks haven't worked either. I guess on the bright side he has started doing his business outside again. He had quit 6 months ago after getting into a bad fight with a stray.
customer_reviews.author: FTexas

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking for a litter box
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I was tired of my kitten flinging his litter all over the place, and my old litter box was extremely unsightly. I don't have room for the litter box in my bathroom or in a closet, or anywhere out of sight really so I needed something for the living room of my small apartment. It definitely contains the litter and my cat enjoys the privacy. It can be hard to scoop out without taking off the colored top entirely, but all in all it's a fine-looking litter box that keeps the litter and....other debris where it should stay.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but don’t expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box I can say it’s okay. This is replacing an existing top entry litter box which the only issue with it is even after a scrub down it still smelled. This new one versus what it replaced is night and day and not in a good way. The original one I had would have outlasted my lifetime. This one being dependent on two clips I don’t have high hopes on its longevity. But for now I will use it and keep my eye out for a better one to keep to side when this one breaks for I am sure it will. The only question is when.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my carpet clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love this, my GF loves it,and most importantly Jefferey loves it. Easy to climb in and out, more space than expected inside. Lid comes off easy and snaps right back in. What like most is how easy it is to pick up and bang a little to help loosen up clumps that stick to the bottom and sides. Also, my cat is very fat (i give him a lot of treats YOLO) and as long as you make sure the lid is in the appropriate slots, the cat is fine. He has not fallen in at all and the lid hasn't even sunk a little. It is a secure lid.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Pittinger

customer_reviews.title: Converted into a Cat Toy Box
customer_reviews.text: My cats hated this litter box. Both are about 15lbs and around 5 years old. They were not a fan of jumping in and out of a "toilet", However, I have now converted this litter box into a cat toy box and they're both fine jumping in and out to grab toys.
customer_reviews.author: E. Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Like it so much, purchased it again 🙂
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this litterbox since Nov 2019. Its very nice quality with a more modern look. I initially purchased the smaller one since i was living in a smaller apartment at the time. My 12lb kitty was able to use it just fine but after awhile (and growing cat) he just looked very cramped and crouched while using it so i bought him the bigger one. My cat approves!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: 7lb cat couldn't fit in this
customer_reviews.text: My cat is not large by any means, and she couldn't fit comfortably in this box. She quickly made messes on the inner walls due to not having enough space to do her business. And at least with a clay litter it still came out and ended up all over my bathroom. I later switched to walnut and paper pellet combo ... but also switched to a standard covered litter box with more internal space!
customer_reviews.author: N. Meador

customer_reviews.title: Less Mess
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES to fling litter out of the box when he goes. I've had this box for a while now and it took us a little bit to transition over because he didn't like the top. So I started him out without the top on then eventually put it on and he's used to it now. I use large black trash bags for liners because I didn't want to go without one. If you need a solution for litter everywhere give this one a try, just start without the lid first. I will say that I wish the lock in was a little easier/sturdier, but once it's in, it does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Seems super large when we got it but in comparison to ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems super large when we got it but in comparison to our hooded litter box it is shorter and slightly less wide. I really, really like the look of it. It helps a little bit with tracking but not enough that I would recommend it to someone for that. Our cat jumps out of it directly onto the toilet which flings the litter around and leaves it on the toilet which is super not fun to sit on in the middle of the night. I would recommend it just because of how much nicer it looks than other litter boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Landry

customer_reviews.title: Cat’s choice
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats are smallish and very active. They prefer the top loader to the front loader 3;1. Because they are small cats the top is secure, even when they jump on it from a nearby dresser. I have no problem cleaning either system. I’m getting a second top loader since they have shown a clear preference and I’m a little lazy about cleaning boxes. The small shovel included is adequate, even though I have a larger metal one Also. The rounded bottom seems easier to clean for me. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: my cat hates it she wont go in it with the lid on it :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The medium is a good size!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this litter box! Zooey went inside right after I set it up. So the transition will be very easy. I got the medium size for my 11 pound 1 year old cat. She seems to fit just fine. This box works very well for our small space. The video shows her getting in and getting out. I am giving it four stars because the scoop is terribly small, I just threw it out. However, I would 10/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jade Aufderbeck

customer_reviews.title: Still a mess and not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this for what we paid. The scoop broke the first month. We have to clean the edges of the litter a lot because our cat must pee very close to the edge so the wet litter sticks to the inside of the box. When she jumps out, there is still litter everywhere so it didn't stop from making a mess. Also, three times now the top has caved in.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Webb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome litter box
customer_reviews.text: I really like this! In my opinion it really does help with the mess. A lot of the litter off their feet catches on the ridges of the lid when they jump off. I’ve noticed I’m cleaning up litter significantly less, my cat took to it easy as well! Already cleaned it once and it’s easy to clean as well, just flip over and poor in trash then clean it as you normally do. Only thing is the large is a tad bigger than expected but after seeing how well my cat likes it I’m definitely glad I got large. It still fits nicely
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats that live with dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these boxes now and bought two more for a friend. I bought my first one when I got my Jack Russell Terrier puppy. It worked great at keeping her out and keeping the litter off the floor was a great bonus. Three years later and she still can’t get into them and the boxes look great and work great. One of my cats had kittens recently and I was concerned about them being able to jump up and get in the box, but by the time they were 8 weeks old they were easily jumping in and out of them. Only down side is that the scoop is small.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Box
customer_reviews.text: After a confused Porch Pirate returned my box (lol), I finally got to let my cat use it. A few key points: 1. This is NOT a small litter box. 2. You will probably need twice the amount of litter to fill it. (I did) 3. Your cat will LOVE IT! I scoop twice a day, but with this litter box and good litter. I can do it once a day. (or wait..) By the way, I have one small framed cat, but this box can definitely fit a bigger cat! I already had a covered litter box and sat them side by side. This one is bigger. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Éjien Verzhíerik

customer_reviews.title: Unintended Benefit - Fits Outdoor Garbage Bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago. It hasn't done that great a job at keeping the litter pebbles from spreading. However, what is great about it is that you can line it with a standard outdoor trash bag (~33 gallon). To clean it, I simply lift the full trash bag, drop that into another (smaller) trash bag in case the cat poked some holes, and then throw the whole thing out. No mess, no bother. Another consideration - if you have a dog that likes to eat cat poop, this litter box gives them too easy access, so you will have to create some kind of obstacle to keep the dog out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Do not get if you mind cleaning up BM on your cats paws.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little box. The only issue I have is it seems to be a tight squeeze for both of my cats to turn around in. Then they get BM on their feet and track it out and all over the house. My one cat is a Maine coon and is about 16 pounds already. My other cat is a very tiny and dainty simesee cat she is only maybe 6 pounds and this happens to her to. I think it need to be designed wider for easier turnablity.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on litter tracking
customer_reviews.text: This cat box is not as sturdy as I hoped. A few times my cats have knocked the locked lid in, which was not okay. Otherwise it has cut down on the litter getting tracked around. My cats adjusted to it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Every Cat!
customer_reviews.text: "Santa" brought this for Miss Reesie who recently moved from outside to full time inside status. I have always hated having a litter box sitting in any area visible by guests. This is thing is huge! Our 2-1/2 year old little guy thought it was a boat and sat down inside of it. Only the top of his head stuck out! Reesie walked around it quite a few times. I tried to put her in and she got startled. Two hours later she was using it like a pro. The litter from her feet is no longer all over the floor which is GREAT! It's a little more work to change the litter and clean but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MelEmme8

customer_reviews.title: Love it! And the cats do too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after seeing a friend's cat use one. I had just moved into a small apartment and needed something that would keep odors from wafting. My cats took to it immediately and the lid really reduced the amount of litter they spread around. I just placed a litter mat under it and cleaned it out regularly. The best part is they can urinate right against the side and it won't drip out (an issue we had with the litter boxes that came with lids). I also appreciate that they can dig in it and litter doesn't end up everywhere. In the end, we bought two!
customer_reviews.author: Kharsa12

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 if these for my 3 cats to keep my dog from eating out of the regular litter box. That part us a win!!! One cat refuses to use it. I'm surprised because she loves to sit on an open human toilet. I had to buy a small box litter box just for her. Someone mentioned their cat fell in the top, that it wasn't sturdy enough. I'm pretty sure she didn't put the lid back on properly. I have a 18lb cat. Just make sure the lid is back in all 3 spots all the way and you won't have any problems. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tammy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for preventing loose litter and looks like fancy furniture
customer_reviews.text: I’m a first time cat owner and these are my thoughts: It’s smaller area than a standard litter box from Walmart. This means my kitten quickly felt too big for the space but I think he still likes it. It’s harder to scoop because of the high walls. I bought the arm and hammer scooping litter box as a sifter and it makes cleanup easier. The included scooper is too small to be useful. Overall I love the product because it means less mess indoors from loose litter particles. I would have bought the bigger one if I could do it again.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small places & aesthetics!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome litter box and a lot bigger than store bought ones. I can actually fill this with an entire container of litter and still have lots of room for my cat to do his business. Just an average size vacuum for size reference it’s in our hall closet so very perfect for small spaces as we live in a 1 bedroom apt. Most of the litter is collected on the top ridges but my cat still manages to get litter on the floor when he scurrys out of the box. I just clean it with the top on as the litter scooper fits in perfectly but very easy to disassemble and deep clean. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pleased for the most part. Only minor mess of kitty litter on the floor to tidy up with a dust pan daily. I wish the lid had little holes for the litter to fall through, since I’m always sweeping it off the top. But my cat likes it and knew how to use it instantly which I was concerned about. It matches my apartment decor and people always comment on that when they come over. It was a little larger that I anticipated but that’s okay. The matching scooper was way too small and took forever to scoop the whole thing so I ordered a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: lid is unstable. NOT good for heavier cats
customer_reviews.text: I give it 2 stars instead of 1 because otherwise, it's a nice, attractive, and functional design, and I hate to give a negative review when clearly the designers were trying to do it right. I like the fact that it's rounded, because that makes it easy to clean -- no corners for wet litter to get stuck in. The lid is difficult to put back, and it can look like it's latched into the slots when it's not ... quite latched. It only took one time for my heavy cat to crash it into the litter, and now he won't go near it. So I have to buy a new one. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Great for poo flingers
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten was flying out of the box like she was shot out of a cannon leaving a litter trail down the hall. This has slowed her exit enough to allow most of the litter bits to fall off of her paws before she gets too far. Bonus - she no longer flings poo out of the box with her aggressive digging. Now she can scratch and dig to her little furry heart's content and everything stays in the box where it belongs. I also noticed the smell is not as strong during our morning scoop sesh. The top opening allows better ventilation than the igloo-looking thing we had before.
customer_reviews.author: S. Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Clean Litter Box
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My cat urinates high. Every time we took the hood off of the previous box to clean, urine had collected along the edges (so gross). This box was the perfect solution - seamless inside, high walls. The cat was opposed to the top entry at first. She stared at it a lot, meowed. I put a step in front to make it easier for her to enter, then took it away. I was determined she would use this more sanitary box, and after a few days she stopped fussing. Very easy to clean and the lid with ridges does reduce the litter drag. Price is extremely reasonable. Don’t hesitate if you’re considering.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Quality is terrible now
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought one in 2017 and it's fantastic. Very good quality, tolerances are tight and overall it's amazing. The 2020 version is trash. The plastic is MUCH lower quality and the lid barely stays on because the fit is so bad. It's very disappointing and I would never recommend this new production model. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: rockee712

customer_reviews.title: Ugh. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this litter box to reduce the amount of litter that our cats would fling from the litter box. Instead, our cats avoided this litter box and did their business elsewhere in the house. This led to nastiness we never had with just the scattered litter mess of the previous standard litter box. Big mistake of a purchase and waste of $25 plus the amount we spent on cleaners and additional loads of laundry to clean up the mess we had after trying this litter box.
customer_reviews.author: S. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Never had poopy paws?
customer_reviews.text: I read the review by someone who said that her cats had poopy paws when using this litter box. It made me very nervous to try this litter box. They've been using this litter box for two months and have never had an issue getting poop on their paws. My cats were from the shelter and had been there for several months, so I wasn't sure if they'd be athletic enough to go in and out of the box. They were barely able to get onto a low level couch. But sure enough, they figured it out. Sometimes my cat will stand up while he poops in this box. I think he just wants some fresh air.
customer_reviews.author: Chambana

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw - top entry release holes allow for urine to get outside of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The design flaw in the cover makes it so that urine is able to come out on the sides where you push the top in to release. I ordered this box so my cat who doesn’t urinate “normally” would have space to do her business how she likes, but the holes in the sides aren’t ideal. This could be easily fixed by changing the design of the lid. Very disappointed this has holes in the side, and I will be discarding this box and going back to the other top entry I’ve used for 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Girlchic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a new 6 month old kitten in February 2020. I bought the large version of this litter box to make sure she could fit in it easily as she got larger. I followed others' advice and took the lid off and put a stool in front of it to get her started. She took right to it! After about a week, I put the lid on but kept the stool there. Again, no issues at all. We eventually removed the stool once she got comfortable around us and being in our house. No issues, ever. This thing is a game changer. It looks nothing like a litter box and blends in nicely in my laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: lorita

customer_reviews.title: No more litter from my Cat who LOVEs to kick litter.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a dream. Easy to clean, scoop and best-of-all; NO MORE LITTER ON MY FLOOR. Seriously, very, very little ever hits the floor and what does, is easily handled by a hand-vac. No more busting out the full vacuum because my Cat wants to kick litter all over. I still hear her doing it in the box and I love knowing that I don't need to follow-up with a vacuum session in the cat room. My cats had no issue using it but I do recommend putting some treats inside the box (before putting in litter) to ensure your cat is willing to get in it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Funderburk

customer_reviews.title: Check sizing but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: At first I bough the medium because it looked big and my cat got in it just fine but didn't have enough room to scratch the litter around and refused to use it. Tried again and got a large and she took to it rather quickly. If you are debating size I would go with the larger one just in case unless you have a very young or petite cat!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi Potts

customer_reviews.title: Saves space
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to save space in our travel trailer on a cross country trip with 2 cats (12 years & 9 years old). They had never used a top entry litter box and had no problems adjusting. They do not jump out onto the top tray if they can help it, so it doesn't cut down on litter on the mat. My 12 year old cat is a big 18 lb fella and had no problem fitting in the box and moving around, which was a concern. Make sure to push the locking tabs from the inside so the lid stays in place. Would recommend if living in small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W

customer_reviews.title: Cat Can't Figure It Out
customer_reviews.text: bought this because I'm a bit of a nerd about modern design.. and it seemed like a good way to keep the area around the box litter free...but, my newly adopted cat doesn't seem to understand it...she's a shelter cat and used to the traditional boxes...so, we're working through this...I bought some disposable litter boxes and place them next to this one...to get her used to the idea I put her in the IRIS box a couple times a day and rub her paws in the litter...hopefully, it won't be much longer before she understands and uses it...
customer_reviews.author: C. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Lid may be difficult to click secure.
customer_reviews.text: Kitty approves. I like the looks of this litter box and it is an ample size (I got large). My kitten is 6 months old 6.5 lbs and she doesn’t feel tight in there. Initially, the lid wouldn’t secure in place but I used some books to weight it down for an hour and now it works fine. I got a second litter box exactly the same for whenever we go away overnight. That one didn’t have any structural issues with the lid. The scooper is a piece of junk. I wouldn’t use it as it would break immediately. I prefer my metal one.
customer_reviews.author: Gergana Vassilev

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and Functional
customer_reviews.text: My male cat does not squat in a litter box so I needed one that had high sides with no seams. A top entry box solves that problem. This is no exception. In addition to that it 1) looks more sleek and attractive, 2) is slightly smaller than other brands, 3) provides a larger entry for the cat, and 4) has better locks than the previous version I had. My cat looks more comfortable doing his business as well as getting in and out. The only downside I have found so far is that it is a bit more difficult to scoop since the locks are so secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Berner

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated litter box snacks for the dog and litter mess from the cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to 1) keep my dog from snacking on litter box treats and 2) to minimize the mess my cat makes by kicking the litter everywhere. My small dog can no longer get in box and litter spread has been minimal. This litter box is huge which makes it a little awkward to clean to me. I end up getting litter on the floor and have to vacuum it up afterwards. It's probably nice for the cat that it's so big. I can hear him kicking and scratching the litter and walls for a long time, he's incredibly thorough 😆, and he doesn't get it all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Helps with tracked litter
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very happy with this box, it hasn’t gotten rid of all tracked litter, but it’s decreased probably 75%. With two cats that’s a big difference! My big boy is a bit awkward in it, he tends to stick his head out the top when he goes and look around embarrassed. I haven’t had any trouble getting the lid lined up and snapped in securely myself, but my kids have gotten it where is collapsed when one of the poor terrified kitties jumped on it. I fully believe that was user error, not the box. Just be sure everything is lined up right. Really glad we got this!
customer_reviews.author: RRL

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Had Crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat was loving this box. She could go without the dogs bothering her. However, I have had this horrible smell in the room since a week after setting up the box. I decided to change brands of litter thinking that may be the problem. When I picked up the box there was urine underneath it; old stick, smelly, nasty urine. The box had been leaking urine this whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The best purchase ever!!!! WITH the pine pellets!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this litter box and it is indeed amazing. I have two cats and they got used to it super fast and to me they are comfortable going to the restroom! lol BUT I have to say that I read one or multiple reviews about using PINE PELLETS instead of cat litter and OMG! this was the best advise EVER! -It is super cheap! -It doesn't smells whatsoever!!! -Super easy to clean -My cats loved it! -It is environmental friendly People don't hesitate, go and get your pine pellets and save some bucks making your cats happy, been nice with the environment and making your life nicer and easier!!! And of course this cat litter box is also awesome.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not Going to Work For Large Cats
customer_reviews.text: Not big enough for my 17lb Siberian boy. There wasn’t enough space for him to jump on top and then weasel his way in through the hole. He meowed in distress the first time he went to use it, just looked at me and looked at the box like “No way, mom!”. And even after cat nip, treats, and gentle encouragement, he wanted nothing to do with it. It was unused so I ended up giving it to my neighbor who has a normal sized cat. The box is cute and I so appreciate that the scoop can hang on the side, just not large enough. The search continues!
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly under the toilet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium, and it is the perfect height and width to fit under my toilet tank next to my bathtub. A tiny amount of litter still tracks out onto the floor, but it is nothing compared to my front-entry litter box. Litter does collect in the top grooves, but this is easy to dump out. My dog is tall enough to still stick his face in the litter box (why are dogs like this?), but since the small size expands our options of litter box placement, we should easily find a spot where it's a non-issue. Lastly, this box is beautiful. I just love the aesthetic of the beige one in my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia C.

customer_reviews.title: He Uses It!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I didn't think my new kitten would use this. I received this at work and all the other cat people said there was no way their cat would use this, but good luck to me. I had to try it because this is the messiest cat ever with his litter. It was EVERYWHERE!!!!!!! He would throw it out for fun. This has been a game changer. He didn't want to go in at first, but he explored it after a bit and used it without issue. The litter now stays in the box and I could not be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ellemarie

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. We used it for several months before switching back to our standard covered litter box. Our cats were able to learn how to use this box quickly and it did create less litter from spreading around the box. However, this was so hard to clean. Due to the way the box latches at the top, it’s impossible to use a litter box liner. Without a liner, the litter would stick to the sides and leave hard residue to clean off. If there was a way they could revamp this product to make it liner friendly, then I think it would be worth it then. For now, it’s easier to use our old box.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Posell

customer_reviews.title: Reduces litter clean up
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My little 3 month old kitten wasn't the biggest fan on the deep jump in, but she managed just fine and within 2-3 weeks got a little bigger and handles it like a champ now. No litter flinging out! And when she hops out onto the lid the litter on her paws usually falls off into the little divers and makes clean up so so easy. The lid snaps in and out so easily and the little scoop hangs from the lid off the edge. It's great and isn surprisingly small spaces. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Much Room Inside for the Cat!
customer_reviews.text: First time buying a top entry litter box, but needed something that wouldn't take up much room and also wouldn't allow cat to leave a mess with litter everywhere. This worked out nicely and liked that it didn't have bunch of holes on top lid so that even more odors could escape. This very roomy inside for large cat to do his business comfortably. The entry and lid allow for him to get in and out with no issues and even allowed him to look in to investigate his new litter box without having to go inside. I may buy more to replace my other litter boxes.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great top entry litter box
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is a great top-entry litter box!! Our cats have really taken to it, and it keeps the floor clean of litter. We have the mat out to keep tracked litter from their paws contained, but the mess is very minimal. I do wish the hole was a little smaller, as my dog can still fit her head inside, but she has trouble reaching the clumps because it's so deep, so it does work to keep her out of the box pretty well. It is definitely not for small spaces, as you can see from the photos. This is a very large box! It works great for us though, and we are very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Essential  Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Small Room Saver
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a place where I would have to keep the litter box in my bedroom and was worried about the smell. Also, my cat had recently started peeing higher and higher and would shoot it over the side and out of the box and didn't want urine on my walls and furniture. I got larger and larger litter boxes with sky high sides (she would just pee out the front). I decided to try this but was worried my cat would have difficulty climbing in or wouldn't trust the lid; it was never an issue. This box contains the smell and sight. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: JAV

customer_reviews.title: You WILL regret it
customer_reviews.text: I spent two weeks training my cat how to use this litter box and STILL she would have accidents. Most notably she would end up stepping in her fecal mater trying to get out of it. Looks like it will be pleasing on the eye, but it in fact very large and still definitely looks (and smells) like a litter box. save your money and buy one with a hood that the cat can easily get in and out of if you want a cover. Also does not reduce the amount of litter they will track out with them. very disappointing. I sent mine back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lebs

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking, compact litter box
customer_reviews.text: Thoughts after owning this box for a month: So we had a top entry litter box from the time our six-year-old cat was a kitten, and I knew we were never using the traditional side-entry boxes we'd had with our previous cat. I LOVE this box. Our cat uses it with no issues and it's stylish. I like that the lid traps the litter better than our previous top-entry box, the Cl*ver C*t. The color scheme (white box + beige top) and the nicer, glossier plastic are more aesthetically appealing, and besides looking nice, it's easy to keep clean by just scooping out every 3rd day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Cool Design. Minimal Litter Spill.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many litter boxes (and brands) for my three cats. I have one cat that likes to pee at the back of litter boxes, often causing spills if the lid-bottom divide is too low. The next best option until this was Nature’s Miracle. This box takes up less space and has no such divide so the marking problem is solved. All three of my cats tend to kick litter out of the litter box, but I’ve found the top entry minimizes the issue; litter is still spilled out of the box, but this style, top entry, has resulted in the least litter spill of the different brands that I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: UVAJen

customer_reviews.title: The cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are fostering a second cat (who seems to be permanent now) and we are still keeping them separated. The foster is a messy boy! He spreads litter around like crazy and loves to dig. We got this hoping to contain some of the mess. It works great and both cats use it as their preferred littler box now. Easy to clean by removing the top. The hook and scoop it comes with are kid of useless but we use our own large scoop with no problems. The size and color are great for our small apartment. Will probably buy another in the future. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Best litter box ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love love this litter box! Design is simple, kitty gets in and out easy. My cat is a litter kicker, but with this box she can kick all over inside and no litter would fly out. And the grid design on top will trap the litter on her way out, so there’s minimum spillage on the floor. Be ware of the type of litter though, I had crystal litter before, and because crystals won’t cake, the bottom of the box picked up yellow stains and won’t wash off. But ever since I switched to clay litter, that problem automatically went away.
customer_reviews.author: Valairex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and handle, it's been a success so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best decision I made on a purchase for my cat. It's super cute, very easy to clean once you get the hang of it and she loves the whole thing of jumping in and out of there to do her thing. I was worried it would be this big clonky thing but it actually works really well in her room and totally goes unnoticed by visitors, and yes the amount of litter all over the floor went from an 8 to a two. All in all totally win, couldn't recommend it more!
customer_reviews.author: Queen Jade

customer_reviews.title: You will be happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! After I tried two litter box this one will solve my problem in scattered litter everywhere. It looks great in my place like a piece of furniture, pretty sight. I did not expect it to be this big if I didn't read the reviews. For prospective point my daughter is 8 years old and Binks &Mila are 12 weeks old. The top idea is genius It's catching a lot of the litter before it hits the floors. The box material (the white side) is not very strong and kind of thinner that expected, but structural wise it should hold good since there's no tension of any sort.
customer_reviews.author: Nez

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: We got one of these litter boxes last year and have enjoyed it's convenience. So we ordered another. But this one is not the same as the first. As the lid does not lock in place tight and falls in or rattles when a cat jumps up. This in turn spooks the cats making them go outside this box. The opposite of the boxes objective. We are highly disappointed that the quality has drastically dropped with this litter box. We wanted to do a return but not willing to pay for the return shipping. We do not recommend this product as Amazon reviewers nor as animal rescuers.
customer_reviews.author: AirHeadReviews

customer_reviews.title: No More Litter on the Floor!
customer_reviews.text: My 12-pound cat fits easily in the medium-sized litter box. I love it because there is no longer litter on the floor. My cat loves to cover his business. He tends to be a bit overzealous in that department. I am thrilled that he can continue the behavior without the mess outside the box. I also switched to Yesterday's News litter and it works perfectly with this. I dump the litter (minus the pooh) in my garden, rinse the litter box with white vinegar and water. I wipe it out with paper towels and voila it is cleaned and ready for re-fill. Takes less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Red Ink

customer_reviews.title: The cats and me love this box!
customer_reviews.text: The baby kitty used this box the first day - took a little longer for the older cat to check it out. We use crystal cat litter and despite them saying it has little dust - this is just not true with two littler boxes and no lids. The older Maine Coon does not like a lid on the box. So, I worried he would not use this box - but he has finally taken to it - interestingly he only poops in it - I was planning on getting another one to replace the large square one we have, as this has contained the dust - just hope he adjusts to pee in it too!
customer_reviews.author: crnurse

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: My cat adapted to using this pretty quickly (she's 4 years old and 10lbs). There seems to be less kitty litter outside of the box than with the traditional ones. The scoop holder is useful. The top of the box isn't the sturdiest but she doesn't weigh much. I've never been able to figure out how to take the top of it off, but I haven't needed to. It doesn't take up much space at all and blends in well in the living room. Pretty satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute design and colors & minimal litter tracking
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didn’t think my cats would use this (14 year old cat and 2 year old picky girls), but they used it right away! I recently downsized so I got rid of my xlarge pet mate cat box and got this top entry and I love it! Very very minimal litter tracking out of the box which is the main reason I love it so much. If I end up getting into a bigger place again I’ll likely end up just purchasing one more for another area of the house, but by far my favorite litter box!
customer_reviews.author: Sydcratsenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, no more daily vacuuming
customer_reviews.text: I got this box because I have a cat who thinks he has to dig a fox hole every time he uses it. Thanks to this box, I went from having to vacuum every day around box to my normal vacuuming schedule. It took my cats a day or two to get used to it. One of my three still won’t use it. Be sure it’s snapped in; slide the flat piece in first, then make sure the other two parts are in snuggly or it will cave in. Guess how I figured that out? It’s easy to clean; I always take the top off but you don’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne in GA

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver litter box!
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is a total hit with my cats. I bought another one so my two cats could each have their own. I was concerned they wouldn't like the top entry, but it was no problem at all. What I haven't liked about any other litter boxes I have used is that my cats pee high so they would either pee down the outside of the box or their pee would leak out of space between the lid and box. This completely solved that issue and it also dramatically cut down on the litter dust. All in all this litter box solved all my issue was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE R

customer_reviews.title: It's ok if you don't have to open the top (the side buttons are not that strong so I wouldn't want to be pushing them everyday) rather just scoop from the hole which seems to be fine. The scooper is pretty skimpy in size but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheap alternative to the modkat litter box. We have 2 modkats so decided to get a cheaper one for our 3rd box.. It's ok if you don't have to open the top (the side buttons are not that strong so I wouldn't want to be pushing them everyday) rather just scoop from the hole which seems to be fine. The scooper is pretty skimpy in size but you can get a bigger one to use. It's a good litter box for a nice price but don't expect the modkat. I do appreciate there is a cheaper alternative though.
customer_reviews.author: Jlee

customer_reviews.title: Best litter box I've found to minimize mess
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats like to pee up the side of the box and the other is an indiscriminate litter scatterer. Both cats adjusted well to using top entry litter boxes and this style of box eliminates any worries about spray over and nearly eliminates litter scatter. Obviously, some litter still gets out of the box on their paws but I'm no longer coming home to heaps of litter on the floor. My main worry was that my cats wouldn't acclimate well to top entry but they were immediately curious and both used it within 30 minutes of set up, even my more persnickety one.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design, little to no litter on the floor, cat likes it, smell is amazingly limited.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: Great for litter containment!
customer_reviews.text: I love these litter boxes! We have 3 cats and they can be never ending poop factories. So I got 2 and the cats prefer these over the open top. I'm guessing it's the privacy. They didn't take at first though. The cats were scared of them. But after a week or so they came to. Does great with containing litter. Though no litter box is perfect so some still gets on the floor. Only issue is cleaning. You either have to scoop through the hole, or pop the top off. Which isn't quick. But I guess it comes with the territory. Came back to order one more so I can throw the open top liter box away! Good riddance!
customer_reviews.author: schlinks

customer_reviews.title: Best for keeping litter in
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about 5 different types of litter boxes, including the newer Tidy Cats Breeze. This is the best when it comes to keeping litter inside. The top has little grooves that trap almost all of the litter when your cat jumps out. Definitely helps to keep others out when you have babies and dogs too. I highly recommend this. The only downfall is the scoop is very flimsy, but honestly, its totally worth it to just buy another scoop. You need this litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Chaely Byers

customer_reviews.title: Less mess
customer_reviews.text: I got this box because i have litter throwers😂 Somehow they still manage to make a mess but its so much better now! The one thing about it is that its kindof difficult to do a complete litter change with one person. Its hard to dump out since its so tall but i like that its tall so i deal. Ive had it a few months and im a little concerned about longevity and if the lid will keep going back in properly but so far its great!
customer_reviews.author: kelsey

customer_reviews.title: My cats took to it immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Cats used it right away. Two kittens. Also got the larger size a few weeks later. Cats jumped in while I was unpacking. ...used it as immediately after filling with fresh litter. They have now abandoned the mid size one altogether which they seemed to originally have liked and used. Their choice -fresh litter in both, they pick the bigger one every time. Easy to clean...keep most littler container but cats are cats and will track some litterI matter what.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Timmo

customer_reviews.title: Absolute lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: We had a few problems with the traditional litter box: our girl kicks after she goes, tracks litter, and our dog loves to try and get a snack when we aren't looking... gross. This box solved all of our problems. We definitely could have gone a size smaller, but I think the bigger size is better with keeping our 40lb dog out (she can't stick her head all the way in). I still suggest having some sort of litter mat to keep the area super clean, but even without the difference in cleanliness in the area is substantial. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: The lid is nice as it prevents things from being on full view
customer_reviews.text: The lid is nice as it prevents things from being on full view, and allows the cat some privacy. It also prevents the wall getting sprayed, and lessens the spillage of litter. The rounded edges make scooping slightly more difficult, but nothing major. It's a nice, large size, and easy to open/close. At $30 it seemed like a good price, but now that the price is significantly higher i am inclined to stick with a regular high-sided litter box. Not to mention that having to wait months to get this from amazon, with no proper expected date, was pretty tedious - hopefully it's not still like that. The cats took to the new box without issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Can you love a litter box? Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: No one really likes litter boxes, right? Wrong!! This one is amazing! My two kitties started using it immediately. I bought the large one and it was easy for them to get in and out and they are only two months old. It’s big enough my two dogs can get in and try and eat the poop. And the scooper works great to only get out the waste and not tons of the litter. I absolutely love this litter box and even just ordered the smaller one to keep in another part of the house!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hairr

customer_reviews.title: I have difficulty cleaning it because it is large and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's big, but there are no handles to grab when it is time to dump the litter. It is rather big and bulky to empty out. Aside from that, my kitten uses it with no issues. It does help with the amount of litter strung on the floor as well. However, I think I'll probably revert back to the box with lid style.
customer_reviews.author: Reads For Fun

customer_reviews.title: My cats aren't large cats but the large was too small.
customer_reviews.text: So, this is a modestly constructed but nice looking litter box. It is taller than it is wide. Unfortunately my cats who are < 12lbs were cramped in it. They refused to use it unless the top was taken off. The top lid had fell into somewhat into the box as though my cat was too heavy for it the lid to remain in place which may have spooked them into not using it. If you have petite kitties, this would be a nice looking addition to an apartment or other space. I bought the Large, so you may need to get the biggest one to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: GT Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Wrong piece
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love this litterbox. I ordered one months ago for my own cat and it’s worked wonders at keeping the dogs out of the litterbox. Plus, it’s cute. I just ordered this black model for a friend, and disappointingly, it came with the wrong scoop/hook combo. My litterbox came with a little metal hook that nests into the grooves so that it lies flush underneath the lid, and you hook the scoop on that. This one came with a plastic hook that is not fitted to this litterbox. It’s not a huge deal, just a tiny inconvenience, but it does suck when I have this product such a glowing recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Keira Luvv

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I waited so long to buy this litter box. A few years ago a friend bought one similar for about $150.. a little pricey for me. But this was so reasonable I bought it as soon as I saw it on Amazon. The type of plastic it is made of tends to stay cleaner than other plastics. Also I do not need to vacuum around it so often as the litter tends to stay in the box. My cat started using it within 10 minutes of receiving it. ( I put the used but clean litter from his old box in it so it wouldn’t seem strange to him)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I downsized from a 3 bedroom apt to a studio so was looking for places to save space...I got the medium and its still pretty big which is why I took a star off of “for small spaces” but it is still a great purchase. There’s no way to completely eliminate litter scatter (Especially if you use lightweight litter and your cat is seemingly part kangaroo) but this box does reduce it nicely. My cat had no problem with the switch from a standard hooded litter box to this one- I just put it in the same spot with a couple scoops of litter from her old box mixed into new litter and it was seamless.
customer_reviews.author: RachieLou

customer_reviews.title: Great for reducing litter spray
customer_reviews.text: If you have problems with litter spray, I would highly recommend this design. I would estimate about 85% less litter spray since I started using it, and now I have two, one for each cat! They did not have an issue figuring out how to get in, though you have to be sure to secure the tabs properly or it will fall into the tub and can be difficult to pop back out. I don't use the scoop that came with it because the holes are too big (I mean, c'mon), but it would be nice to be able to use the scoop and hang it inside the box!
customer_reviews.author: May Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Great little litter box
customer_reviews.text: My cat prefers the top entry and it helps keep my dog out of the litter but most top entry boxes are big. I have a smaller place and a very small cat. This fits my cat and my bathroom Much better and is actually cuter which is a nice bonus. I try to put a garbage bag liner inside to keep these cleaner which hinder the locking feature just a little, I just have to ensure a little more that the top locks in place correctly. If not using a bag then easy to take off and snap on.
customer_reviews.author: AmyS

customer_reviews.title: Can I say a litter box is stylish?
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a particular room for the litter box, so it's by our laundry machines in a somewhat open-plan area. Because of that, i wanted to get a litter box that looked decent. This fit the bill for that. After we bought it we were concerned about our rescue cat learning how to use it - but she figured it out within the first few hours of being at our house. She's at the vet getting spayed today so I'll have my first opportunity to completely empty and hose down the litter box since we got it - because of the design (round walls, no corners) I'm expecting no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL NEW TYPE LITTER "TUB"--NO NEGATIVES!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! What can I say? This litter "tub" is absolutely great--Such an improvement over "regular" litter boxes. This replaces a large box with a hood/roof--cats kept throwing litter out the door. They seem to like this so much better--all they have to do is jump in. Took no time with transition--2-3 days without top, and then all together. So much cleaner--and so easy to clean--that "small" scoop enclosed with unit works really well on getting everything clean--of course with the "perfect" litter--A & H Clump and Seal. So glad I saw this item--and happier that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: John R Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cats ❤️ It
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats and 4 different kinds of litter boxes... this one is used the most not because it is in the most used space but because they like it the most. It has a slotted cover that traps most the litter before they hop out of it so this limits the mess around the box. I will say they like to harass each other while using the litter box... many times one sits on top while the other one is inside and the one on top swats at the one inside just to mess with him/her. So it’s a bit of a fun potty too!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Pioli

product_meta.title: IRIS Top Entry Cat Litter Box with Cat Litter Scoop
product_meta.description: Color:White/Beige| Size:LargeKeep Fido’s nose out of the cat’s business with this unique Open Top Litter Box by IRIS USA, Inc. Your cat will love the easy top access that provides them room to move around and not make a mess. The grooves on the lid create a built in mat to prevent litter from scattering when leaving their litter box. The rounded shape and attachable hook to hang the included litter scoop makes for quick and easy cleaning. Available in multiple colors.
feature_bullets: Unique and stylish design that gives your feline friend privacy. Bpa free
Prevents litter scatter. Keeps Fidos nose out of the cats business
Round corners allow for easy cleaning. Non-skid rubber feet
Prevents dogs from making a mess with the litter
Inside Dimensions: (Widest point) 20.0"L x 16.0"W x 14.0"H (Bottom narrowest point) 17.5"L x 13.5"W

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
